    Plots the semi-variogram

    st_semiv.Rd

    Plots the semi-variogram given the locations, times and the quantity of interest.

    st_semiv(
  locations_df,
  times_df,
  values_df,
  latitude_linear = TRUE,
  longitude_linear = TRUE,
  missing_value = -9999,
  width = 80,
  cutoff = 1000,
  tlagmax = 6
)

    Arguments

    locations_df

    The dataframe containing latitude and longitude (colnames lat and lon).

    times_df

    The dataframe containing the dates in Date format.

    values_df

    The dataframe of dimension length(times) x length(locations) containing the quantity of interest.

    latitude_linear

    If TRUE a linear model is fitted with latitude as a covariate is fitted.

    longitude_linear

    If TRUE a linear model is fitted with longitude as a covariate is fitted.

    missing_value

    If a certain value such as -9999 denotes the missing values for given locations and times.

    width

    A parameter to the gstat::variogram function. The width of the distance intervals to be considered.

    cutoff

    A parameter to the gstat::variogram function. The spatial separation distance.

    tlagmax

    A parameter to the gstat::variogram function. The maximum time lag.

    Examples

    library(dplyr)
data(locs)
data(Times)
data(Tmax)
temp_part <- with(Times, paste(year, month, day, sep = "-"))
temp_part <- data.frame(date = as.Date(temp_part)[913:943])
Tmax <- Tmax[913:943, ]
st_semiv(locs,
        temp_part,
        Tmax,
        latitude_linear = FALSE,
        longitude_linear = FALSE,
        missing_value = -9999,
        width = 50,
        cutoff = 1000,
        tlagmax = 7
)
